SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.task

Interface Scheduler

All Superinterfaces:
ThreadedModule
All Known Implementing Classes:
AsyncScheduler, SchedulerThread, SyncScheduler
public interface Scheduler extends ThreadedModule
A scheduler. Handles the lifecycle of tasks.
See Also:
  • Task
  • SyncScheduler
  • AsyncScheduler

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    register(Task task)
    Registers a task to this scheduler.
    void
    registerAsync(Iterable<? extends Task> tasks)
    Registers multiple tasks to this scheduler asynchronously, instructing it to distribute every task provided evenly across every thread of this scheduler.
    void
    registerSync(Iterable<? extends Task> tasks)
    Registers multiple tasks to this scheduler synchronously, instructing it to register every task provided to a single thread in order to guarantee sequential execution.
    void
    unregister(Task task)
    Unregisters a task from this scheduler.
    void
    unregister(Iterable<? extends Task> tasks)
    Unregisters multiple tasks from this scheduler.

    Methods inherited from interface civitas.celestis.util.ThreadedModule

    getThreads, interrupt, start

  • Method Details

    • register

      void register(@Nonnull Task task)
      Registers a task to this scheduler.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to register to this scheduler

    • registerSync

      void registerSync(@Nonnull Iterable<? extends Task> tasks)
      Registers multiple tasks to this scheduler synchronously, instructing it to register every task provided to a single thread in order to guarantee sequential execution.
      Parameters:
      tasks - An iterable object containing the tasks to register synchronously

    • registerAsync

      void registerAsync(@Nonnull Iterable<? extends Task> tasks)
      Registers multiple tasks to this scheduler asynchronously, instructing it to distribute every task provided evenly across every thread of this scheduler.
      Parameters:
      tasks - An iterable object containing the tasks to register asynchronously

    • unregister

      void unregister(@Nonnull Task task)
      Unregisters a task from this scheduler.
      Parameters:
      task - The task to unregister from this scheduler

    • unregister

      void unregister(@Nonnull Iterable<? extends Task> tasks)
      Unregisters multiple tasks from this scheduler.
      Parameters:
      tasks - An iterable object containing the tasks to unregister from this scheduler
